At Fri, 25 Jun 2010 14:30:30 -0000,
davide.canali@... wrote:
> 
> Hel=
lo,
> 
> I've been running Heritrix 1.14.3 for a while and I noticed that a=

> quite high percentage of downloaded pages result in a 404 error.
> Inves=
tigating the problem, many of them appear to be composed of a
> normal URL =
plus a content-type appended to it. E.g.:
> 
> http://newyorkyearbook.com/2=
009/07/text/css
> 
> In this case, the page that takes there is:
> http://n=
ewyorkyearbook.com/2009/07/ and here there is no link to
> "text/css" (neit=
her absolute nor relative).
> 
> Also some scripts lead to incorrect URLs, =
such as:

> http://mediafetcher.com/flv_player/swfobject.js
> 
> that lea=
ds to: http://mediafetcher.com/ShockwaveFlash.ShockwaveFlash.7
> 
> I suppo=
se there is some bug in the way URLs are extracted by some of
> the extract=
ors (the JavaScript one and maybe others). Does anybody

und to this problem? Or, can you point me to the

heck in order to try to fix the bug?

Hi Davide,

Heritrix performs lots of=
 =E2=80=9Cspeculative=E2=80=9D extraction to try to get all
possible links.=
 Sometimes this results in the generation of links that
result in a 404.

I=
 would not think of this as a =E2=80=9Cbug=E2=80=9D, more of an necessary e=
vil. If
you fix it, there may be URLs out there which Heritrix will no long=
er
fetch because the fix prevents them from being extracted.

If you want t=
o fix this, I imagine that these are being generated by
the ExtractorJS, Ex=
tractorSWF or possibly ExtractorHTML. You could try
disabling them or chang=
ing the settings, bearing in mind that the
consequence may be that some goo=
d links which may otherwise have been
extracted will no longer be.

Somebod=
y else may have more specific information.

best, Erik Hetzner
